predictions.text: The EU Council will renew (extend) the EU’s sectoral economic sanctions on Russia by 2026-01-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the Council of the European Union (or European Council) issues a press release/Official Journal notice stating the renewal/extension of Russia-related sectoral economic restrictive measures on or before 2026-01-31 (UTC). Otherwise NO.
evidence: U.K. intelligence warns Russia is escalating destabilization across Europe, which typically sustains EU political support for continued sanctions: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/12/15/world/europe/uk-mi6-russia-chaos.html

U.S. officials say Ukraine peace talks are progressing but uncertainty remains; sanctions are often renewed absent a finalized settlement: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/15/ukraine-peace-talks-russia-eu-us-trump.html
monitoring_signals: Council of the EU press releases on Russia restrictive measures
EU Official Journal (L series) for renewal regulations/decisions
European Commission/Council calendar items related to Foreign Affairs Council
predictions.rationale: EU sanctions renewals are routine and politically easier than lifting them; current security warnings support continuation through the next renewal window.

predictions.text: The U.S. Treasury Monthly Statement will report Customs Duties (tariff receipts) of at least $20.0B in at least one month by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if any Treasury Monthly Statement for a month ending on or before 2026-03-31 shows Customs Duties (or equivalent line item) >= $20.0B (not cumulative FYTD). Otherwise NO.
evidence: Customs says tariff collections hit $200B under Trump policy, indicating elevated run-rate receipts: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/15/trump-tariffs-trade-customs-imports.html
monitoring_signals: U.S. Treasury Monthly Statement (receipts table) releases
CBP monthly trade/tariff collection commentary
Any announced tariff rate or coverage changes affecting near-term receipts
predictions.rationale: With reported elevated tariff collections, a $20B monthly print is plausible during seasonal import surges or if tariff coverage expands.

predictions.text: The ICE BofA MOVE Index will close at or below 75.0 on at least one trading day by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the ICE BofA MOVE Index closing value is <= 75.0 on any trading day on or before 2026-03-31 (UTC). Otherwise NO.
evidence: Two Fed officials signaling inflation risks look contained supports lower rate volatility regimes: https://www.marketwatch.com/story/two-fed-officials-who-rarely-agree-both-say-inflation-will-not-be-a-problem-going-forward-f5425178
monitoring_signals: Daily MOVE index closes
Fed communications shifting expected policy path
Inflation surprises (CPI/PCE) affecting rate vol
predictions.rationale: If disinflation narrative holds and cuts remain on the table, rate vol can compress into mid-70s, though policy uncertainty caps confidence.

predictions.text: PayPal will publicly disclose that U.S. regulators have either approved or denied its application to form a U.S. bank by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if PayPal (press release, SEC filing, or earnings call transcript) or a U.S. regulator (e.g., OCC/Fed/FDIC) publicly states an approval or denial decision on PayPal’s bank formation application on or before 2026-06-30 (UTC). Otherwise NO.
evidence: PayPal applied to form a U.S. bank, creating a clear regulatory decision point: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/15/paypal-seeks-us-approval-to-form-bank-offer-small-business-loans.html
monitoring_signals: OCC charter application decisions and notices
PayPal 10-Q/10-K and earnings call Q&A
FDIC/Fed public orders if applicable
predictions.rationale: High-profile fintech bank applications often reach a public decision or disclosure within a few quarters, but timelines can slip.

predictions.text: Ford’s new battery storage business will announce at least one signed commercial contract (customer order or long-term agreement) for a data-center battery storage deployment of at least 50 MWh by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if Ford (or the storage unit) publicly announces a signed customer contract explicitly tied to a data center with size >= 50 MWh on or before 2026-06-30 (UTC). Announcement must include customer/partner name or contract size. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Ford is launching a battery storage business targeting data centers and grid services: https://techcrunch.com/2025/12/15/ford-is-starting-a-battery-storage-business-to-power-data-centers-and-the-grid/
Ford is scaling back EV plans, increasing incentives to monetize adjacent electrification capabilities like stationary storage: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/15/ford-ev-pullback.html
monitoring_signals: Ford press releases and investor presentations mentioning stationary storage bookings
Data center operator announcements of storage procurements
Interconnection/permit filings indicating large behind-the-meter storage at data centers
predictions.rationale: Data-center power demand is strong, but contract size disclosure and execution speed for a new entrant make this a lower-confidence call.

predictions.text: The U.S. Department of Defense (or a DoD-controlled entity) will announce a finalized definitive investment agreement for the Korea Zinc Tennessee smelter project by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if DoD (or an identified DoD investment vehicle) publicly announces execution of a definitive agreement (not just intent/MOU) to invest in the Korea Zinc Tennessee smelter project on or before 2026-03-31 (UTC). Otherwise NO.
evidence: Pentagon taking ~10% stake highlights industrial-policy support and supply-chain de-risking for strategic metals: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/15/pentagon-korea-zinc-refinery-tennessee.html
monitoring_signals: DoD press releases (Industrial Base/OSD) and DPA-related announcements
Company filings/press releases from Korea Zinc or project SPV
Congressional notifications related to defense industrial investments
predictions.rationale: If a stake has been telegraphed, moving from concept to definitive documentation within a quarter is plausible for strategic-materials projects.

predictions.text: The Nasdaq-100 Index (NDX) will have at least one single trading day with a close-to-close decline of 3.0% or more by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if NDX daily close shows a decline of >= 3.0% versus the prior trading day close on any day on or before 2026-03-31 (UTC). Otherwise NO.
evidence: AI-infrastructure stocks sold off, raising the odds of further high-beta tech volatility: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/15/ai-infrastructure-selloff-continues-broadcom-oracle-coreweave-shares-slide.html
Asia-Pacific equities fell as the U.S.-led AI selloff spilled over, indicating broader risk-off sensitivity: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/16/asia-markets-nikkei-kospi-hang-seng-australia.html
monitoring_signals: Daily NDX returns
Earnings and guidance from mega-cap and AI infrastructure names
Realized/implicit equity volatility (VXN/QQQ IV) and liquidity conditions
predictions.rationale: A 3% down day is common in tech-heavy indices during valuation resets or macro surprises; recent AI-capex jitters increase probability.

predictions.text: Russia will issue an official statement acknowledging a successful Ukrainian unmanned maritime/underwater attack causing material damage to a Russian naval submarine by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if an official Russian government or Russian Navy/Defense Ministry communication (website, verified social channels, or state media citing MoD) explicitly acknowledges Ukrainian unmanned maritime/underwater systems damaged a Russian submarine on or before 2026-03-31 (UTC). Otherwise NO.
evidence: Ukraine claims an underwater drone struck a Russian submarine, but confirmation/acknowledgment is uncertain: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/12/15/world/europe/ukraine-russia-submarine-drones.html
monitoring_signals: Russian MoD/Navy communications and incident reports
Independent OSINT confirmations that might pressure acknowledgment
Satellite imagery and reputable investigative reporting on submarine status
predictions.rationale: Even if damage occurred, official acknowledgment is politically costly; resolution requires explicit admission, making this low probability.
